text: To all those celebrating Rosh Hashanah in #NY02 and across the country, may this new year bring peace, health, and prosperity to you and your families. Shanah Tovah. https://t.co/eZHRyBxd9X

Americans deserve more choice in how they invest for retirement. That’s why I joined my @FinancialCmte colleagues in calling on @SECGov Chair Atkins to support @POTUS’ EO to expand 401k options and put investment decisions in the hands of the workers saving for their future.

Grateful to @RepPatRyan, @RepMikeLawler, @RepNicole, @RepLaLota, @RepTenney, and @RepJoeMorelle for joining me in this effort. 

We stand united to confront the crisis of veteran and servicemember suicide and to honor those we’ve lost. More here ➡️https://t.co/lGVliGniHy

Too many of our nation’s heroes return home only to be lost to the unseen wounds of war.

That’s why I introduced a resolution to officially recognize the Suicide Awareness and Remembrance Flag and to designate Sept. 22 as National Veterans Suicide Awareness and Remembrance Day. https://t.co/Lh0JBgMkqM
On POW/MIA Recognition Day, we honor America’s prisoners of war, those still missing, and the families who bear their sacrifice. You are not forgotten. https://t.co/h1ekgs47KP
Happy 78th Birthday to the @usairforce! https://t.co/J6kUp1R3Dt

Today we celebrate Constitution Day, honoring the signing of the document that laid the foundation of our great Republic.

The Constitution set the framework for our democracy, secures our freedoms, and stands as a testament to the strength of the American people. https://t.co/hEMr88yZpO

I’m thankful that a strike has been averted and that negotiations will move forward. I urge all parties to remain at the table and reach an agreement for the sake of the hundreds of thousands of Long Island commuters who rely on the LIRR every day. My office will continue to closely monitor the situation as it progresses.

I joined @MorningsMaria this morning to honor the lives lost 24 years ago today and to highlight the tens of thousands still suffering from 9/11-related illnesses. 

This summer, we lost my friend Jamie Atkinson to that fight. Congress must safeguard the @WTCHealthPrgm to give heroes like Jamie the care they need to face this battle.

24 years ago at 8:46 AM, Flight 11 struck the North Tower of the World Trade Center, marking the start of the deadliest terror attacks on U.S. soil. In the hours that followed, 2,977 innocent lives were taken in New York City, at the Pentagon, and in Shanksville.

Today, we honor their memories and all those still suffering the lasting impacts of September 11, 2001.

We will #NeverForget.

My prayers are with Charlie Kirk’s wife and two young children as they endure this heartbreaking loss. There is never an acceptable justification for political violence, and this assassination of a public figure is a tragedy that must be unequivocally condemned by all.

Thank you to @RepJoshG for co-leading this Resolution and @RepLaLota, @RepMikeLawler, @RepTenney, @RepNicole, and @RepLangworthy for joining us in this effort to preserve the memory and lessons of 9/11 and ensure our nation never forgets.

September 11, 2001, changed our nation forever. For future generations who did not live through that day, we must keep our promise to “Never Forget.” 

I’m calling on all 50 states to require 9/11 education in schools. ⬇
https://t.co/URv9eXlGKd

On September 11, 2001, nearly 500 innocent Long Islanders were taken from their families and loved ones, never to return home. 

May we Never Forget their names, their stories, and their sacrifice.
https://t.co/HqPHorIX6n

Twenty-four years later, our 9/11 heroes and survivors are still paying the price. Nearly 50,000 are now battling cancer.

Protecting the @WTCHealthPrgm is a moral imperative to honor their sacrifice and ensure they receive the care they earned. 

https://t.co/rM0ib99ZG4

Today marks 80 years since V-J Day and the end of World War II. We honor the Greatest Generation and the tens of thousands of New Yorkers who never made it home. Their sacrifice protected the freedoms we hold dear and made sure liberty prevailed over tyranny. https://t.co/LF3yZmJlTp

Happy Labor Day! Today we honor the hardworking men and women who built this country and continue to move it forward. On Long Island and across America, your work is what keeps our nation strong. Thank you for all you do. https://t.co/n6Bf4k8y1i

Four years ago, 13 U.S. servicemembers were killed at Abbey Gate in Kabul during the botched Afghanistan withdrawal. Their courage and sacrifice will never be forgotten. Today, we honor these American heroes and stand with the families who carry this loss. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/gc2GsPgAnH

Hurricane Erin is set to bring dangerous rip currents and powerful waves to the South Shore this week. I urge everyone to stay out of the water and put safety first. Learn more⬇️

Nassau County's David S. Mack Center for Training and Intelligence and new Training Village together set a national standard for how law enforcement prepares to meet evolving threats. As @HomelandGOP Chairman, I will ensure Washington backs this mission. https://t.co/PaTAeSbGMa

I’m grateful to @NassauExec & @NassauCountyPD  for inviting me to the David S. Mack Center for Training and Intelligence. I was thoroughly impressed by this state-of-the-art facility. 

As @HomelandGOP Chairman, I am committed to ensuring law enforcement has the resources, training, and real-time intelligence they need. This is how we protect New York and communities nationwide.

https://t.co/eWqSKaCiO9

Today marks 235 years of the United States Coast Guard protecting our shores and saving lives. The men and women of the Coast Guard get the job done with skill and dedication. Thank you for always being ready. https://t.co/yaiX3K4nYy

For too long, Long Islanders paid more and got less because of the unfair SALT deduction cap.

We fought to raise the cap and we won.

This is real tax relief for hardworking middle-class families, and it takes effect this year.
https://t.co/Kn4eIxZp46

After a hard-fought battle, the new $40k SALT cap takes effect this year, putting thousands back in the pockets of hardworking Americans. 

I’m proud to have led this fight as Co-Chair of the SALT Caucus, and I’ll never stop pushing for policies that put LI families first. https://t.co/TsMcJyb47U

NASA is a symbol of American ingenuity and discovery. For 67 years, it has led the world in space exploration and continues to inspire the next generation to reach new heights. 

Happy Birthday, @NASA. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/O4VFW6l7Es

I strongly condemn last night’s horrific act of violence in New York City. My prayers are with the wife and children of NYPD Officer Didarul Islam, the families of the three other innocent people killed, and those injured during this depraved attack. I am grateful for the swift response by the NYPD and the continued support of the FBI during this ongoing investigation. I remain in contact with Secretary Noem and law enforcement, and will continue to monitor the federal response to this tragedy. At this time, authorities believe the shooter acted alone and that there is no active threat to the public. We will do everything in our power to bring clarity to what happened, and keep our communities safe.

The Committee on Homeland Security was created in response to the September 11 attacks.  As a New Yorker, I’m proud to lead this panel and will work to protect NY and the nation so we never experience another 9/11. 

Watch my interview with @News12LI ➡ https://t.co/k6dlhwebVh https://t.co/6hMKlCAA6Z

Early this morning, a Suffolk County Police 3rd Precinct officer was shot in the line of duty. Thankfully, he has been treated and is in stable condition. My thoughts are with his family, with the 3rd Precinct, and with all of SCPD. Any violence against law enforcement is abhorrent, and I commend SCPD for apprehending the suspect and doing their job with the professionalism and resolve we count on every day.

Honored to have been selected to chair the House Committee on Homeland Security. I’m ready to lead the fight to protect our homeland and keep Americans safe. 

Read my full statement⬇️
https://t.co/wPxirKHhMe

Democrats want to ban ICE agents from wearing masks, putting them at risk of retaliation from MS-13 and other violent criminals. 

They would rather target law enforcement than hold criminals accountable. 

I will always stand with our officers. https://t.co/sHl6QgBNjb

https://t.co/oLWn8JtiRc

My dear friend Jamie Atkinson has lost his years-long battle with 9/11-related cancer. As a 19-year-old Community Ambulance Company volunteer and MTA Police Officer, Jamie spent weeks at Ground Zero clearing the pile. In the years since, he dedicated his life to serving his community and helping others. He will be greatly missed and never forgotten.

PTSD is a leading risk factor for veteran suicide, yet too many still suffer in silence. On PTSD Awareness Day, we recommit to supporting those who served and ensuring they have access to care. Veterans can call 988 and press 1 for confidential support. 
https://t.co/weyto1zYtx

I was saddened to learn of the passing of former Congresswoman Carolyn McCarthy. She was a tireless advocate for Long Island whose commitment to public service and lasting contributions will not be forgotten.

Political violence has no place in this country. I was proud to vote for H.Res. 519 condemning the horrific and senseless attacks on Minnesota lawmakers and reaffirming our commitment to preserving a democratic system built not on fear, but on civility and the peaceful exchange of ideas.

I applaud President Trump’s decisive leadership in taking out Iranian nuclear sites. The world’s top state sponsor of terrorism simply cannot have nuclear weapons capabilities. God bless America and our brave troops.

On this day we commemorate when the last enslaved Americans were informed of their freedom. On June 19, 1865, more than two years after the Emancipation Proclamation, Union troops arrived in Galveston, Texas and announced the end of slavery. 

Happy Juneteenth 📜 https://t.co/h4MQlvdVuI
My statement with fellow Republican SALT Caucus Co-Chair @RepYoungKim on preserving the SALT deal we negotiated in good faith with the Speaker and the White House.⬇️ https://t.co/12OMUSGU9z

There is no place for political violence in our society. I condemn the targeted shootings of Minnesota lawmakers and their spouses in the strongest possible terms. My prayers are with the victims, their families, and the people of Minnesota.

For 250 years, our soldiers have defended this country in war and peace, often at great personal cost. We thank the men and women of the Army who have served with courage and conviction—and honor those who gave their lives to protect the freedoms we hold dear. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/1ZrWnRbRSx
Today we honor the American flag—our enduring symbol of freedom, unity, and sacrifice. Happy Flag Day. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/3FoLKK44VX

Iran is the world’s top state sponsor of terrorism—arming Hezbollah, funding Hamas, and threatening Israel’s survival. A nuclear Iran is an existential threat. We stand with Israel and must do everything possible to ensure it never acquires a nuclear weapon.

Today, I chaired an @HomelandGOP Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection hearing on securing AI to strengthen U.S. cybersecurity.

As adversaries weaponize this technology, we must ensure it’s built and deployed securely to protect our infrastructure and stay ahead of emerging threats.

I voted for the HALT Fentanyl Act to help law enforcement stop the flow of deadly fentanyl into our communities. This crisis is taking lives in #NY02 and across the country—we need stronger tools to confront it head-on. Now it heads to the President’s desk for his signature.

✅ PASSED: The House has passed my bill, the Protecting Our Nation’s Capital Emergency Act—a critical step toward restoring law and order in Washington.

My bill, the Protecting Our Nation’s Capital Emergency Act, is about to come up for a vote.

D.C. is facing a public safety crisis—and its police force is dangerously understaffed.

Congress must act. I urge my colleagues to support this bill and stand with those who risk their lives to keep our capital secure.

Today, we honor the heroes of D-Day—the Allied troops who stormed the beaches of Normandy 81 years ago to defend freedom and liberate a continent. 

Their courage changed the course of history, and their sacrifice will never be forgotten. https://t.co/BeRhwbGP2Y

This morning, I voted to pass the Budget Resolution. Let me be clear: the resolution did not make any funding cuts to specific programs. 

This was just the first step. Now, committees get to work determining the policy substance of the reconciliation package. 

This is how we secure SALT relief, protect Medicaid, and deliver on the promises made to the American people.

NEWS: Earlier this week, Dr. John Howard was dismissed as Administrator of the @WTCHealthPrgm. I immediately met with the White House to urge the Administration to reverse this unfortunate mistake, and today I received word that HHS has reinstated Dr. Howard to his position. I will always fight to protect this program and the 9/11 heroes and survivors it serves.

During last night’s joint address, President Trump honored Stephanie Diller, widow of NYPD Officer and Long Islander Jonathan Diller, who was shot and killed during a traffic stop last March by a repeat offender. We must never forget the sacrifices of law enforcement families.

Our community was devastated by this senseless tragedy. I appreciate President Trump’s recognition of Stephanie and her son and his call for stronger measures to protect our heroes in blue.

Today, I joined with 9/11 survivors and responders to reintroduce the 9/11 Responder and Survivor Health Funding Correction Act. This bill would ensure the @WTCHealthPrgm has the resources needed to care for those suffering from 9/11-related conditions.

I thank my House and Senate co-leads and our 9/11 advocates, responders, and survivors who have fought tirelessly for this program. We made a promise to never forget. Today, we stood together to reaffirm our commitment to delivering on that promise.
WATCH: Today, we announced the reintroduction of the 9/11 Responder and Survivor Health Funding Correction Act to safeguard 9/11 health care.

I am pleased to announce that @WTCHealthPrgm staff are being reinstated. This comes after my close and continued communication with the White House. This is a huge victory for 9/11 first responders and survivors. I appreciate President Trump’s commitment to making sure these heroes continue to receive the health care they need.

Grants for the @WTCHealthPrgm were under threat earlier this week—jeopardizing vital 9/11 cancer research. I immediately contacted the White House, and I’m pleased to say the grants have been restored. Grateful to President Trump for taking swift action in support of 9/11 responders and survivors.

Tonight, Representatives from NY, NJ, and CA met with President Trump to discuss critical issues, including SALT. As Republican Co-Chairs of the SALT Caucus, @RepYoungKim and I released the following joint statement:
